012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import java.sql.ResultSet;
015import java.sql.ResultSetMetaData;
016import java.sql.SQLException;
017
018import java.util.Iterator;
019import java.util.List;
020
021import org.postgresql.pljava.ResultSetProvider;
022import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.Function;
023import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
024
025/**
026 * Demonstrates {@code @Function(out={...})} for a function that returns a
027 * non-predeclared composite type.
028 */
029@SQLAction(requires = { "helloOutParams", "helloTable" }, install = {
030    "SELECT" +
031    "  CASE WHEN want IS NOT DISTINCT FROM helloOutParams()" +
032    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'composite return passes')" +
033    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'composite return fails')" +
034    "  END" +
035    " FROM" +
036    "  (SELECT 'Hello' ::text, 'world' ::text) AS want",
037
038    "WITH" +
039    " expected AS (VALUES" +
040    "  ('Hello' ::text, 'twelve' ::text)," +
041    "  ('Hello',        'thirteen')," +
042    "  ('Hello',        'love')" +
043    " )" +
044    "SELECT" +
045    "  CASE WHEN every(want IS NOT DISTINCT FROM got)" +
046    "  THEN javatest.logmessage('INFO',    'set of composite return passes')" +
047    "  ELSE javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'set of composite return fails')" +
048    "  END" +
049    " FROM" +
050    "  (SELECT row_number() OVER (), * FROM expected) AS want" +
051    "  LEFT JOIN (SELECT row_number() OVER (), * FROM hellotable()) AS got" +
052    "  USING (row_number)"
053})
054public class ReturnComposite implements ResultSetProvider.Large
055{
056    /**
057     * Returns a two-column composite result that does not have to be
058     * a predeclared composite type, or require the calling SQL query to
059     * follow the function call with a result column definition list, as is
060     * needed for a bare {@code RECORD} return type.
061     */
062    @Function(
063        schema = "javatest", out = { "greeting text", "addressee text" },
064        provides = "helloOutParams"
065    )
066    public static boolean helloOutParams(ResultSet out) throws SQLException
067    {
068        out.updateString(1, "Hello");
069        out.updateString(2, "world");
070        return true;
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * Returns a two-column table result that does not have to be
075     * a predeclared composite type, or require the calling SQL query to
076     * follow the function call with a result column definition list, as is
077     * needed for a bare {@code RECORD} return type.
078     */
079    @Function(
080        schema = "javatest", out = { "greeting text", "addressee text" },
081        provides = "helloTable"
082    )
083    public static ResultSetProvider helloTable()
084    throws SQLException
085    {
086        return new ReturnComposite();
087    }
088
089    Iterator<String> addressees =
090        List.of("twelve", "thirteen", "love").iterator();
091
092    @Override
093    public boolean assignRowValues(ResultSet out, long currentRow)
094    throws SQLException
095    {
096        if ( ! addressees.hasNext() )
097            return false;
098
099        out.updateString(1, "Hello");
100        out.updateString(2, addressees.next());
101        return true;
102    }
103
104    @Override
105    public void close()
106    {
107    }
108}
